samples.question: Do you think that famous people enjoy being famous?
samples.transcript: 50-50. Depends on the personality. I would not say all the people are enjoying the fame. Some people get accidentally famous and then they want to have their own personal. So they do not want to take a picture with all the people, with their friends, and then they just want to have some privacy.
samples.transcript_original: 50-50. Depends on the personality. I wouldn't say all the people are enjoying the fame. Some people get accidentally famous and then they want to have their own personal. So they don't want to take a picture with all the people, with their friends, and then they just want to have some privacy.

samples.question: So first, Rashmi, do you work or do you study?
samples.transcript: Oh, I study. I am studying at Queen's University and, I am studying a master's in marketing and majoring in marketing analytics. Excellent.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, I study. Uh, I'm studying at Queen's University and, uh, I'm studying a master's in marketing and majoring in marketing analytics. Excellent.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Oh, I study. I am studying at Queen's University and, I am studying a master's in marketing and majoring in marketing analytics. Excellent.

samples.question: Why did you choose that degree?
samples.transcript: Oh, I chose, to study analytics because, I am interested in big data and big data is, Becoming really popular these days. A lot of companies are, have now started to look at their dark data. Dark data which means like data which was collected but they have not done anything about it. it is just lying around in the database. So now companies are starting to use that data to analyze it and look at trends, past and future trends, which is false in the predictive analytics category. So I very much interested in looking at both the behavior of data and the consumer behavior which the data tells you So analytics lets me study that and look at the data in terms of how you can manage your customers better So I want to learn analytics because of that Is there anything that you would like to study in the future I would like to study Python programming language I currently studying that and I would like to master it because it lets you create and develop your own programs because these days the data analytics software is very expensive So it it gives you much more power to control your own dashboards and you can create it on your own So I want to learn Python programming because of that Excellent. And.

samples.question: What kind of place is your hometown?
samples.transcript: I come from a very small city in India. it is in western, northwestern region. it is called Baroda. And it is a princely state. We still have a king who lives in a palace there. So there are lots of palaces throughout the city. And, it is called the cultural capital of, my state. Because, there are a lot of, like, reading and exhibition. Arts and culture is, very much promoted there.
samples.transcript_original: I come from a very small city in India. It's in western, northwestern region. It's called Baroda. And it's a princely state. We still have a king who lives in a palace there. So there are lots of palaces throughout the city. And, uh, it's called the cultural capital of, uh, my state. Because, uh, there are a lot of, like, reading and exhibition. Arts and culture is, uh, very much promoted there.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I come from a very small city in India. it is in western, northwestern region. it is called Baroda. And it is a princely state. We still have a king who lives in a palace there. So there are lots of palaces throughout the city. And, it is called the cultural capital of, my state. Because, there are a lot of, like, reading and exhibition. Arts and culture is, very much promoted there.

samples.question: And what is the most interesting part of your hometown?
samples.transcript: I would say the palaces. There are a lot of palaces throughout the city. And they are, like, really beautiful. in the past, only the king was allowed to be there. But now, it is open to the public. So we can go around and see all those palaces and there are lots of museums in it with, 1800 years of history. So it is really great. and also we have, a river which, flows through the city and it is very famous for having a lot of crocodiles in it and it was featured on National Geographic. So, because it is the largest river in a city with most number of crocodiles in it. So that is a custom attraction I would say.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, I would say the palaces. There are a lot of palaces throughout the city. And they're, like, really beautiful. Uh, in the past, only the king was allowed to be there. samples.question: And, what jobs do people do in your home town?
samples.transcript: Well like I said, my city is, very small. So, most of the people have small businesses, they are business owners. And, the students there, they do not, they do not really have too many opportunities, so they go out, either out of the city, or they go out, abroad to study, or to, to, to look for an occupation. But in my city there are not too many opportunities sadly. But there, we have, like, some big companies like pharmaceuticals and we have chemical industries. So those type of jobs we do have, yes. And.

samples.question: What is your favorite color?
samples.transcript: I do not really have a favorite color. it is like, depends on my mood. But I am told that I am most of the time I tend to wear white or black. that is what I am told. But I do not really think of a color when I go to buy clothes. I just like pick anything. I do not think I have a favorite color. No.

samples.question: And are there any colors that you dislike?
samples.transcript: I dislike red. it is because, I had a traumatic experience once so that colour scares me. but other than that, there is no colour that I dislike.
samples.transcript_original: I dislike red. It's because, uh, I had a traumatic experience once so that colour scares me. Um, but other than that, there's no colour that I dislike.

samples.question: And are there any colours in your country that have a special meaning?
samples.transcript: Yes, but India is a secular country but most of us are Hindus so orange is the colour of my religion. So you, you will see orange flags on temples. So orange is very prominent. But the Muslims, they are in minority, but there, there are a lot of Muslims in my country. So they have the green flags. So whenever there is a festival, a Hindu festival, you will see people wearing orange and waving orange flags. And whenever there is a Muslim festival, you would see like people in processions carrying green flags and wearing green. Well done. Okay.

samples.question: Intonation?
samples.transcript: Okay. So intonation is the tone of your voice. So we convey meaning when we are speaking English. We convey meaning through words, through facial expressions, but also the tone.

samples.question: Is there anything that you dislike about public transport?
samples.transcript: When it comes to the things that I do not like, I would say, what I do not like is basically, the crowded place. I mean, you know, a lot of people are trying to get on the bus.
